articles.description: Ange Postecoglou's Tottenham are playing bold, attacking football and their best start since the double year of 1960-61 has them top of the Premier League.
articles.title: 'We want fans to dream' - 'excitement' coming back to Spurs

articles.description: Afghanistan secure highest ever run chase in one-day international cricket with a stunning eight-wicket win over Pakistan in Chennai.
articles.title: Afghanistan stun Pakistan in World Cup thriller

articles.description: What had been the best race of Mercedes' difficult 2023 season was wrecked when Lewis Hamilton's car was disqualified from the United States Grand Prix for a technical infringement.
articles.title: 'How did Mercedes make such a mistake?'

articles.description: World Rugby confirms it will formally review Bongi Mbonambi's alleged use of discriminatory language towards England's Tom Curry.
articles.title: World Rugby to review Mbonambi racial slur allegation

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who is a 'lovely footballer'? Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: Arsenal say increasing diversity is a "key priority" after the club were criticised for having no black, Asian or minority ethnic players in their women's squad photo.
articles.title: Arsenal acknowledge lack of diversity in women's team

articles.description: Watch highlights as Afghanistan beat Pakistan for the first time in one day cricket with an eight-wicket victory in Chennai at the Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: Afghanistan claim historic win over Pakistan

articles.description: Tottenham return to the top of the Premier League as goals from Son Heung-min and James Maddison are enough to defeat Fulham.
articles.title: Son and Maddison on target as Tottenham return to top

articles.description: Jonny May believes England are in good hands under coach Steve Borthwick, who the winger describes as a "genius".
articles.title: Borthwick a 'genius' with 'an approach like Turing'

articles.description: England need to play more domestic and international 50-over cricket to stay competitive at World Cups, says batter Joe Root.
articles.title: England don't play enough 50-over cricket - Root
